item.description:
First Quarterly Convention of the
Liberty Preservation Association of Massachusetts Inc.
http://www.masslpa.or...
12:00 – 6:00 pm October 25th, 2008
18 Grafton St Worcester MA
Mint Restaurant

The mission of our first State convention is to continue the momentum created by
Dr. Paul ‘s Presidential campaign and to harness local grassroots activism by building a unified statewide political action network which will better utilize our resources and talent base to effectively return our state and federal governments to their constitutional roots.

We hope to train, educate and groom potential candidates to replace the tax & spend socialists and the pro-war neo-cons.

The plan is to hold quarterly state conventions, which will provide the necessary personal interaction and network building, expert training, moral and physical support needed to accomplish our national, regional and statewide goals.

Our organization is close to obtaining a 501 (C) 3 status (FAQ). This status allows the MassLPA Inc. to raise funds and hold events. We are also in the process of upgrading our website to create an interactive venue for visitors that are searching for or contributing current information on local, state, regional and national issues and a calendar of action events.

Meeting Agenda

Itinerary:

(Item 1) 12:00 – 1:00: Meet & Greet with refreshments

(a) Sign in.
(b) Introductions.
(c) Convention debriefing.
(d) Misc. Announcements (various speakers).

(Item 2) 1:00 – 2:50: Chair brings meeting to order with brief introduction.

(a) Nomination and ratification of Board Members (District Coordinators).
(b) Discussion and ratification of Charter / By-laws.
(c) Discussion and ratification of Brad Wyatt as C4L State Coordinator.
(d) C4L report by Brad Wyatt and Tom Moor.
(e) Candidate updates.
(f) Discussion & action regarding Bailout, Question #1 & opposition campaigns.
(g) Political progress (i.e. State Committee & RTC seats).
(h) Identify existing group resources.
(i) Projections for 2010-2012 candidates.
(j) Comments and concerns of members.

( Ten Minute Break )

(Item 3) 3:00 – 4:00: How to beat city hall.

Susan Allen will speak on her congressional campaign and her recent victories as a political activist as well as what’s necessary to succeed when fighting “city hall.”

Susan is currently in the process of suing Barney Frank and calling for his impeachment.

(Item 4) 4:00 – 5:00:

(a) Unveiling of new website.
\(b) Red Pill Politics interview with G. Edward Griffin.
(c) Discuss possible “Boston Tea Party “ event and money bomb Sun December 14th Faneuil Hall
(d) Adjourn meeting.

(Item 5) 5:00 – 6:00: “Party Time” - entertainment and refreshments.

Bob Dwyer
cell: 508-930-5530
MassLPA.org
Liberty League PAC
The TAX Foundation
End The Income Tax
Vote YES on 1 November 4th to END the State Income Tax
Cut government waste!
Give back an average of $3,700 each to 3,400,000 workers and taxpayers – every year!
item.name: First Quarterly Convention of Liberty Preservation Association of Massachusetts
